page.title: 03THE OLD QUARRIES
page.content: Gabbro and Blue Elvan was quarried at Porthoustock until 10 years ago. It was a source of employment for local men. The ships came to load up at the jetty which is now only used by fishermen. The conveyor brought the stone to the jetty and loaded it onto the ships. The Gabbro was used for roads, driveways, cement and buildings. This quarry was known as the 'West of England' quarry. Dean Quarry still gets stone from the 'West of England' stockpile. Therefore some machinery is still there but blasting no longer takes place. St. Keverne Quarry, now disused, was used during the war for local aerodrome building at Predannack. This quarry closed 25 years ago and is now privately owned.
